listitem.para: JDK 1.4 notes: Since with JDK 1.4 Xalan is included you do not have to make any additional configuration like putting Xalan, Xerces into the classpath. On how to use newer versions of Xalan than the one coming with the JDK 1.4 refer to the Xalan homepage on http://xml.apache.org/xalan-j. In JDK 1.5 it changed again and by default there is no possibility anymore to invoke xalan from the commandline (see http://www.biglist.com/lists/xsl-list/archives/200503/msg01112.html for more information) and in addition the packagenames in the JDK changed (from org.apache.xalan.xslt.Process to com.sun.org.apache.xalan.internal.xslt.Process). Probably the easies way with JDK 1.5 is to put Xalan again in the classpath as it was done with JDK1.3 but I did not spend very much time yet to investigate further.

section.title: Examples
section.para: Note that string parameters must be surrounded by a single quote ('), else they will be interpreted as a number.
For gexslt, all parameters are string values, so the single quotes are not needed, unless they contain embedded blanks, which might confuse the shell.
Gexslt can also take any XPath expression as a parameter value, but this is not possible via geant.
section.programlisting:
<xslt input="${GOBO}/doc/structure/index.xml" stylesheet="${GOBO}/doc/misc/gobo2db.xsl" output="${GOBO}/doc/structure/index2.xml" >
